txt.en: 'You say that Lady Tóla sent you to speak with Lady Góda? I will not then deny you entrance. However, be aware that there is a bitter debate within between Ingbert, Ingmar, and Góda.\n\n'I do not recommend interrupting them, unless you have good reason to. If you still wish to enter, let me know, and I will unlock the door.'
'Alas, [placeholder], I am still torn between loyalty to my King and to my people.'
Lady Tóla fears for the life of her husband, Ingmar, who desires glory in battle against the Orcs.
You have gained the trust of Reeve Ingbert
Talk to Adalmód to gain entrance to the Mead Hall of Eaworth
Adalmód stands guard outside the Mead Hall of Eaworth.\n\nYou should speak with Adalmód when you are ready to enter the Mead Hall.
Talk to Reeve Ingbert within the Mead Hall of Eaworth
Reeve Ingbert is within the Mead Hall of Eaworth.\n\nYou should speak with Reeve Ingbert regarding the discussion you witnessed.
